bibl.title: The Archive of Tryphon Phibas.
bibl.note: Three papyrus letters addressed to an individual by the name of Tryphon Phibas. They were purchased in February, 1931, from an antiquities dealer ('Dr. Kondilios') in Cairo. Provenance unknown, first half of third century. - 1. P. Yale (P. CtYBR) Inv. 615. An anonymous regnal 'year 8' should correspond to AD 200 or 229. - 2. Inv. 642. - 3. Inv. 648. From the same sender (Apion) as Inv. 642. - Pp. 233-234: Appendix: [Re-edition of] P. Yale I, 84. Letter from Apion to Tryphon Hibas, acquired in the same batch of papyri as the three preceding.
bibl.seg: BENAISSA Amin, The Archive of Tryphon Phibas.

Three papyrus letters addressed to an individual by the name of Tryphon Phibas. They were purchased in February, 1931, from an antiquities dealer ('Dr. Kondilios') in Cairo. Provenance unknown, first half of third century. - 1. P. Yale (P. CtYBR) Inv. 615. An anonymous regnal 'year 8' should correspond to AD 200 or 229. - 2. Inv. 642. - 3. Inv. 648. From the same sender (Apion) as Inv. 642. - Pp. 233-234: Appendix: [Re-edition of] P. Yale I, 84. Letter from Apion to Tryphon Hibas, acquired in the same batch of papyri as the three preceding.
